item.title: [GROOVY-10674] STC crashes when combining use-site variance with bounded polymorphism
item.description:
I have the following Groovy program.

class Main {
  static Foo<Bar<Byte, Byte>, ? super Bar<Byte, Byte>> foo = new Foo<>(new Bar<>())
}

class Bar<T extends Number, S extends T> {}

class Foo<M extends Bar<Byte, ? extends Byte>, D extends M> {
  D x
  public Foo(D x) {
    this.x = x
  }
}

Actual Behavior

The program crashes the compiler and produces the following stack trace

comments.comment:
Also, note that before https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-10153 was fixed, the compiler rejected the program with the following error message:

org.codehaus.groovy.control.MultipleCompilationErrorsException: startup failed:
Main.groovy: 2: The type ? is not a valid substitute for the bounded parameter <D extends M>
 @ line 2, column 31.
     static Foo<Bar<Byte, Byte>, ? super Bar<Byte, Byte>> foo = new Foo<>(new Bar<>())
                                 ^

1 error

Finally, the following program is compiled successfully:

class Main {
  static Foo<Bar<Byte>, ? super Bar<Byte>> foo = new Foo<>(new Bar<>())
}

class Bar<T extends Number> {}

class Foo<M extends Bar<Byte>, D extends M> {
  D x
  public Foo(D x) {
    this.x = x
  }
}
